item.title: Printable Emergency Contact List Templates
item.author: Andrew Dunham
item.description:
In an emergency, you don't want to have to go hunting for contact information for insurance or utilities â€“ and you might also not be the one going looking. An up-to-date emergency contact list is a gesture of kindness towards a very stressed out version of your future self or potentially a loved one.

We wrote up two formats for this contact list. We put a copy of the longer detailed version on our fridge as well as in the glovebox of each car, and in our go bags. The shorter wallet card will fit right in your wallet, perhaps next to your health card or insurance card. Both are Google Docs - copy them or download them as Word or OpenDocument files, edit with your information, and print out as many copies as seems useful.

Emergency Contact List Template - Full Version

Here's hoping you never need to use them!

item.title: Home Solar, Part 2: Definitions and Terms
item.author: Andrew Dunham
item.description: This blog post is the second in a series about installing solar panels on our house. In this post, we'll go over many of the definitions and terms that we came across, and try to define them in a way that's useful for someone that's not an electrician or solar installer.

item.title: Home Solar, Part 1: Introduction
item.author: Andrew Dunham
item.description: We've just finished a long-running project to install solar panels on our house. This is the first of a series of posts about the project, where we aim to cover everything from the initial planning to the final installation, along with posts on ongoing monitoring, troubleshooting, and lessons learned.
